info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 15 at 2:56PM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...Another Round of Wintry Weather Comes To Western Nevada... * The next storm system is approaching Western Nevada this afternoon, with snow showers and breezy winds this evening through Thursday morning. Disruptions to the evening commute are possible, with a higher likelihood of travel delays Thursday morning. Allow extra time for your commute and plan for icy road conditions. * Periods of snow may intermittently mix with rain below 5,000 feet, but most areas will receive between a dusting and 2 inches of snow. The higher mountain ranges above 7,000 feet could receive 3 to 7 inches. The likely onset of snow showers will be between 7 and 10 pm for Pershing and Churchill counties, and midnight for Mineral and Southern Lyon. * South to southwest winds will be breezy this evening into tonight with the strongest winds near US-95 near Walker Lake where wind gusts may locally approach 45 mph at times.
